nodes.text: A terrestrial planet located in the Indoumodo system of Wild Space, Indoumodo was a lush world with jungles and forests that were home to kouhuns, poisonous arthropods that dwelled in damp caves and passages underground. The creatures were also known to dwell in vast, hollow trees and hunted dog-sized creatures that lived in the trees' crevices. Located near the end of the Corellian Run, Indoumodo was a destination for assassins and poisoners who would venture to capture the kouhuns for use as untraceable killers.

Shortly prior to the outbreak of the Clone Wars in 22 BBY, the bounty hunter Jango Fett tasked fellow hunter Zam Wesell with using a pair of starved kouhuns from Indoumodo to assassinate Senator Padmé Amidala on Coruscant. The assassination was a failure as both kouhuns were killed by Jedi Anakin Skywalker.

Indoumodo was introduced via mention in the 2002 reference book Star Wars: Attack of the Clones: The Visual Dictionary, written by David West Reynolds. The planet received a visual depiction in the 2006 reference title The New Essential Guide to Alien Species. The 2009 book The Essential Atlas placed the Indoumodo system, and thus Indoumodo, in grid square S-18.

In contrast to other sources, the Star Wars Roleplaying Game Revised Core Rulebook, a 2002 rulebook for the Star Wars Roleplaying Game from Wizards of the Coast, claims that the homeworld of the kouhuns is unknown. The forty-eighth issue of Star Wars: The Official Figurine Collection, released in 2007, incorrectly spells the planet's name as "Induomodo."
